pl.edu.agh.jdziennik.wrapper.wrappingaccess

Class WrappingAccessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • pl.edu.agh.jdziennik.model.dbaccess.DBAccessor
      • pl.edu.agh.jdziennik.wrapper.wrappingaccess.WrappingAccessor

  • public class WrappingAccessor
extends DBAccessor
    This class serves as an abstraction layer between DBAccessor and controllers. It provides methods that perform certain queries accepting and returning wrapped objects. Instances of this class use the underlying superclass, DBAccessor, to perform queries.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WrappingAccessor(org.hibernate.Session session)
      Creates a new WrappingAccessor using the Session passed.

        public javafx.collections.ObservableList<WrappedClass> wqueryAllClasses()

        the observable list

      • wqueryPresenceWithDate

        public javafx.collections.ObservableList<WrappedAttendance> wqueryPresenceWithDate(Student student,
                                                                                   Attendance.AttendanceValue attendanceValue,
                                                                                   java.sql.Date from,
                                                                                   java.sql.Date to)
        Queries attendances of given student in given time range from the database. Uses the underlying hibernate session to get the attendances with value attendanceValue, that correspond to student and the time range from-to. Wraps them as WrappedAttendances and returns them as an observable list.
        Parameters:
        student - Is the student, who's attendances are queried.
        attendanceValue - Is the value of attendances queried.
        from - Specifies the time period, attendances from which are being queried.
        to - Specifies the time period, attendances from which are being queried.
        Returns:
        the observable list

      • wqueryParentOfStudent

        public WrappedParent wqueryParentOfStudent(WrappedStudent student)
        Queries parent of given student from the database. Uses the underlying hibernate session to get the parent of student and wraps the parent as WrappedParent, which it returns.
        Parameters:
        student - Is a wrapped version of the student, who's parent is queried.
        Returns:
        the wrapped parent

      • wqueryClassOfStudent

        public WrappedClass wqueryClassOfStudent(WrappedStudent student)
        Queries teaching class of given student from the database. Uses the underlying hibernate session to get the the class student is the member of, wraps it as WrappedClass and returns it.
        Parameters:
        student - Is a wrapped version of the student, who's teaching class is queried.
        Returns:
        the wrapped class

      • wqueryCurrentTimeWindow

        public WrappedTimeWindow wqueryCurrentTimeWindow()
        Queries current time window from the database. Uses the underlying hibernate session to get a single time window with start time lower than current hour and end time higher, than current hour. Wraps the queried time window as WrappedTimeWindow and returns it.
        Returns:
        the wrapped time window

      • wqueryLesson

        public WrappedLesson wqueryLesson(java.sql.Date date,
                                  WrappedWeekTerm weekTerm)
        Queries specific lesson from the database. Uses the underlying hibernate session to get the the lesson, that took place on date in terms of weekTerm, wraps it as WrappedLesson and returns it. Returns null if there's no such lesson.
        Parameters:
        date - Is the date when the queried lesson took place.
        weekTerm - Is a wrapped version of the weekTerm, that connects the queried lesson to specific time, class, teacher and subject.
        Returns:
        the wrapped lesson

      • wqueryAttendance

        public WrappedAttendance wqueryAttendance(Student student,
                                          Lesson lesson)
        Queries attendance of given student on given lesson from the database. Uses the underlying hibernate session to get the attendance of student on lesson and wraps it as WrappedAttendance, which it returns. Returns null if there's no such attendance.
        Parameters:
        student - Is the student, who's attendance is queried.
        lesson - Is the lesson, attendance on which is queried.
        Returns:
        the wrapped attendance

      • createStudent

        public WrappedStudent createStudent(WrappedClass teachingClass,
                                    java.lang.String name,
                                    java.lang.String surname,
                                    java.lang.String PESEL,
                                    WrappedParent parent)
        Adds new student to the database. Uses the underlying hibernate session to persist a new student object created from teachingClass, name, surname, PESEL and parent. Returns the new student object wrapped as WrappedStudent.
        Parameters:
        teachingClass - Is a wrapped version of the teaching class of the new student.
        name - Is the name of the new student.
        surname - Is the surname of the new student.
        PESEL - Is the PESEL of the new student.
        parent - Is a wrapped version of the parent of the new student.
        Returns:
        the wrapped student

      • createClass

        public WrappedClass createClass(java.lang.String id,
                                WrappedTeacher tutor)
        Adds new teaching class to the database. Uses the underlying hibernate session to persist a new class object created from id and tutor. Returns the new teaching class object wrapped as WrappedClass.
        Parameters:
        id - Is the id of the new class (i.e. "3c").
        tutor - Is a wrapped version of the teacher to be the tutor of the new class.
        Returns:
        the wrapped class

      • createParent

        public WrappedParent createParent(java.lang.String name,
                                  java.lang.String surname,
                                  java.lang.String phone)
        Adds new parent to the database. Uses the underlying hibernate session to persist a new parent object created from name, surname and phone. Returns the new parent object wrapped as WrappedParent.
        Parameters:
        name - Is the name of the new parent.
        surname - Is the surname of the new parent.
        phone - Is the phone of the new parent.
        Returns:
        the wrapped parent

      • createTeacher

        public WrappedTeacher createTeacher(java.lang.String name,
                                    java.lang.String surname)
        Adds new teacher to the database. Uses the underlying hibernate session to persist a new teacher object created from name and surname. Returns the new teacher object wrapped as WrappedTeacher.
        Parameters:
        name - Is the name of the new teacher.
        surname - Is the surname of the new teacher.
        Returns:
        the wrapped teacher

      • createLesson

        public WrappedLesson createLesson(WrappedWeekTerm weekTerm,
                                  java.lang.String topic)
        Adds new lesson to the database. Uses the underlying hibernate session to persist a new lesson object created from weekTerm and topic using current date. Returns the new lesson object wrapped as WrappedLesson.
        Parameters:
        weekTerm - Is the weekTerm on which the new lesson takes place.
        topic - Is the topic of the new lesson.
        Returns:
        the wrapped lesson

      • createAttendance

        public WrappedAttendance createAttendance(WrappedLesson lesson,
                                          WrappedStudent student,
                                          WrappedAttendanceValue attendanceValue)
        Adds new attendance to the database. Uses the underlying hibernate session to persist a new attendance object created from lesson, student and attendanceValue. Returns the new attendance object wrapped as WrappedAttendance.
        Parameters:
        lesson - Is the lesson to which the new attendance corresponds.
        student - Is the student, to whom the new attendance corresponds.
        attendanceValue - the attendance value
        Returns:
        the wrapped attendance

      • createGrade

        public WrappedGrade createGrade(Student student,
                                ClassSubject classSubject,
                                Grade.GradeValue gradeValue,
                                GradeType gradeType,
                                java.lang.String comment)
        Adds new grade to the database. Uses the underlying hibernate session to persist a new grade object created from student, classSubject, gradeValue, gradeType, comment using current timestamp. Returns the new grade object wrapped as WrappedGrade.
        Parameters:
        student - Is the student, who is being given the new grade.
        classSubject - Represents the subject, in which the student got the grade.
        gradeValue - Is the value of the new grade.
        gradeType - Is the type of the new grade.
        comment - Is the comment attached to the new grade.
        Returns:
        the wrapped grade

      • createClassSubject

        public WrappedClassSubject createClassSubject(WrappedClass wClass,
                                              WrappedSubject subject,
                                              WrappedTeacher teacher)
        Adds new classSubjects to the database. Uses the underlying hibernate session to persist a new classSubject object created from wClass, subject and teacher. Returns the new classSubject object wrapped as WrappedClassSubject.
        Parameters:
        wClass - Is a wrapped version of the teaching class the new classSubject shall correspond to.
        subject - Is a wrapped version of the subject the new classSubject shall correspond to.
        teacher - Is a wrapped version of the teacher teaching subject to this class.
        Returns:
        the wrapped class subject

        Parameters:

        newTopic - the new topic
